column3: Are there any internal or external links to `./COPYING`?\n

@MarcoFalke I fixed that. I haven't touched src/univalue and src/secp256k1 as these seem to be imported from separate repositories (where PRs are pending: https://github.com/bitcoin/univalue/pull/1 and https://github.com/bitcoin/secp256k1/pull/376)\n
I'm not aware of any such a rule... There appear to be other MIT-licensed projects using COPYING.\n

NACK.

IMO not worth the huge diff that this generates. And I've never heard of this "rule". For the legal standing it makes no difference.

I can't see how you "fixed" my concern. External links still give the [404 GitHub page](https://github.com/prusnak/bitcoin/blob/919a445362f12a25d761a786fbd73677c6078971/COPYING) for `./COPYING`.

I think it is good enough to keep as is for now.
weak ACK as it is the default for GitHub repositories (AFAIK).\nMeh otherwise.\n

> the default for github repositories

But we're not striving to be a default github repository, it is not a goal to shape the project after their preferences :-)

It's just not worth the effort, I'd prefer focusing on the zillions of actual user-facing issues that are open.
